Update Canned Response in Account

PATCH

/

api

/

v1

/

accounts

/

{account\_id}

/

canned\_responses

/

{id}

Try it

cURL

Python

JavaScript

PHP

Go

Java

Copy

```
curl --request PATCH \
  --url https://app.chatwoot.com/api/v1/accounts/{account_id}/canned_responses/{id} \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --header 'api_access_token: <api-key>' \
  --data '{
  "content": "Hello, {{contact.name}}! Welcome to our service.",
  "short_code": "welcome"
}'
```

200

403

404

Copy

```
{
  "id": 123,
  "account_id": 123,
  "short_code": "<string>",

}
```

#### Authorizations

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/canned-responses/update-canned-response-in-account#authorization-api-access-token)

api\_access\_token

string

header

required

This token can be obtained by visiting the profile page or via rails console. Provides access to endpoints based on the user permissions levels. This token can be saved by an external system when user is created via API, to perform activities on behalf of the user.

#### Path Parameters

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/canned-responses/update-canned-response-in-account#parameter-account-id)

account\_id

integer

required

The numeric ID of the account

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/canned-responses/update-canned-response-in-account#parameter-id)

id

integer

required

The ID of the canned response to be updated.

#### Body

application/json

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/canned-responses/update-canned-response-in-account#body-content)

content

string

Message content for canned response

Example:

`"Hello, {{contact.name}}! Welcome to our service."`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/canned-responses/update-canned-response-in-account#body-short-code)

short\_code

string

Short Code for quick access of the canned response

Example:

`"welcome"`
